unit_learning_outcomes.description: Plan for rich opportunities for developing early language and literacy learning for children from diverse backgrounds across different early childhood education and care, family and community settings.

Design, engage in and critically evaluate developmentally appropriate and inclusive language and literacy learning experiences for young children aged from birth through to and including the year of transition into primary school.
Apply current research to critically evaluate the role of intentional teaching, play and literature-based learning experiences and environments in early language and literacy learning.
Apply current research, policies and pedagogical approaches to analyse and evaluate early language and literacy education.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Independent learning, including activities such as participating in online discussions, completing learning tasks available on the iLearn site of the unit, developing learning and academic writing skills, engagement with literature for children.
Weekly reading - 3 hours per week for 13 weeks

assessments.description: Students analyse an interaction between an adult and a child during shared reading of a picture book, select a picture book for that child and design a literacy learning experience for that child using the selected picture book. 2000 words.

assessments.assessment_title: Promoting infant-toddler language and literacy in ECEC settings
assessments.description: Drawing on research literature on language and literacy development in the infant and toddler years, students write a report with evidence-based recommendations for designing and evaluating the physical and interactional environment of infant-toddler rooms in ECEC settings in terms of its potential to promote language and literacy learning. 1500 words.

assessments.assessment_title: Language and literacy profile and planned experience for a preschool-aged child
assessments.description: Each student finds a child aged between 3 and 5 years, who has not yet started school, and on the basis of information about the child’s previous language, literacy and literature experiences and two observations of the child’s interactions and engagement with picture books, designs, engages the child in and evaluates a language and literacy experience that integrates children’s literature and play. Students complete and submit: a completed literacy experience plan and evaluation (1-2 pages) and a 1200-word paper that includes a language- and literacy profile of the child and a justification of the student’s incorporation of children’s literature and play. (Total word limit: 1800 words).

assessments.assessment_title: Observing and evaluating a learning environment for infants and toddlers.
assessments.description: Students observe a learning environment for infants and/or toddlers, evaluate its physical and interactional qualities in terms of their potential to promote language and literacy learning, and make recommendations for improving and using that potential. (1800 words)

data.subject_search_title: EDST2120 - Language and Literacy Learning in Early Childhood
data.description: This unit builds on foundational knowledge of theories of the connection between language, literacy and learning and examines pedagogies for supporting children to develop language and literacy from birth through to their transition into primary school. Students will draw on current research, policies and pedagogical approaches to examine the role of intentional teaching, play- and literature-based experiences as well as childcare, family and community environments in early language and literacy learning. They will design, engage in and critically evaluate developmentally appropriate and inclusive language and literacy learning experiences for young children from diverse backgrounds.
